review_text: We did enjoy our stay and it would’ve been great to utilize the pool if it was warmer outside! Unfortunately we did have a very hard time sleeping because the AC/Heat unit on the wall, made a very loud noise the whole time we stayed. And no matter what setting we put it on, we could not get the noise to stop. We also had to login to our Hulu account on the TV because it was a smart tv. But not logged in to anything so we had to utilize our own account. Other than those couple of little inconveniences, we were happy with our stay. The place was clean and we would’ve slept well if the AC wasn’t making such loud noise lol they are very nice people and they’re very helpful/respectful.

I let them know, but I ended up just going to bed because they had prior commitments and didn’t have time to help me. Unfortunately, I think the change in arrival date, wasn’t actually convenient for them. I loved the place though. Great bed, nice kids and sweet dogs. I would go there again- in good weather so we could enjoy the pool.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This isn't just a clean comfortable place to stay; it has personality that shows "above and beyond" planning on the part of the host. We've been spoiled by some very nicely decorated places but none have had such a perfectly themed and well put together feel. The kitchen was modern where it needed to be, new glass top stove and countertops, yet the refrigerator had the theme of the house nailed. There were games, snacks, waters, cabinets with everything you'd need for a great meal. The living area had a large couch and collection of pillows for ideal comfort. Good thing because the stay that we planned ahead for, happened to be right in the middle of a semi-tropical storm. Instead of being on the go, walking and sight seeing, we spent more time than usual at home, and felt like the weather didn't interrupt our fun at all. The bathroom is spacious, spotless, and updated. Laundry area with full sized washer and dryer. Everywhere we looked, there were nice touches.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: It was great to have our own space for Thanksgiving weekend. We were able to come and go from our son's house and have our own space which was priceless. There was no way in the world we could sleep in the tall bed or be prepared for just how tall it was. Thankfully we always travel with a suitcase of linens for a queen size bed so we slept on the pull out sofa. Late the last afternoon we decided that another night on that sofa bed was more than we could take and headed for home early. We would stay again if the bed is ever changed to one we could sleep in. They do make kits to lower those old beds. We know because we have an antique pineapple post bedroom set that it works on. We have no complaints otherwise.

review_text: We had the opportunity to book Collins Quarters for our in-laws to come in from North Carolina for my grand daughter’s Christening. The property was very well maintained and the hosts were very responsive. We didn’t have any issues to come up that required us to reach out during our stay, but Ashley answered all questions promptly and throughly before hand. The lighting was a bit dim in that room, but we could see that it was completely spotless! In fact, the entire home was very clean!!! So if you have someone who requires lots of quiet, that’s their room, for sure! Other than that one thing, this place is definitely worth the price and it’s being added to my favorites when we have to bring in family again!!!

name: Adam
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Ashley and Gene’s place was clean and spacious! The decor is wonderfully eclectic and it was the right size for our party of 4. You won’t find another property like it in the area! We especially appreciated all the small touches like bottled water, snacks, coffee and creamer in the kitchen, fresh linens, and the extra blankets in the bedroom. The downstairs bed and half bath were definitely a bonus if you have a light sleeper or someone looking for their own quiet space in your party! It was perfect for our family trip, and we highly recommend it to anyone who is looking to stay in a quiet spot close to everything you need in Florence. MUSC Hospital, Starbucks, grocery stores and restaurants are all less than a 5-minute trip away, and it’s also convenient to downtown and Francis Marion University. They had thought of everything, but with the small questions we did have, they were also very quick to respond and assist. Book this place! You won’t be disappointed.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
This was our first experience and it was delightful. It was just as described, and what we needed for the one night stay. We wanted to make our trip back to NJ a little more than just another night in a hotel and it was just about the same for a hotel room. The experience was a bonus.
We loved that we felt safe. It was nice to have game night after being on the road all day. Keyless entry was definitely a bonus. Although we didn’t have to bother Shannon, she left her number available for us to contact her along with all the information we needed to enjoy our stay. A few things I would note is that the beds in the back are for small kids, and one of the 3 dogs barked non stop all morning lol. Having a five month old, the sound didn’t bother us, actually made it feel more like home. We hope to stay with there again on our next trip.
Thank you!

Wonderful stay!
Beautiful, well kept farm with fabulous haPPY animals everywhere you look at this delightful Shangri-La.
Hidden out beyond the main house was the terrific, clean and cozy Airbnb cottage. Totally private with trees, a pond, stables, huge fenced in land with aninals and a large yard to walk about.
AND,
Shannon left us yummy treats to enjoy inside the cottage, including 6 FRESH eggs just laid by the sweetest hens!!
We bought an extra dozen fresh hapPY hen eggs to take home too!
Shannon was kind, extremely generous and super helpful.
I highly recommend this lovely place!

review_text:
An absolute gem. Book it you won’t regret it! Great spot when traveling 95, wayyyyy better than stopping at some raggedy hotel.
My dog and I had an amazing time and would’ve loved to stay longer if we were able. The place is exactly as pictured, so super cute and functional. The eggs are a nice treat! The bed was comfy and the shower pressure was good. Plenty of creature comforts
The highlight is obviously the farm itself. It was a tonic to interact with llama, goats, sheep, horses. The goats were especially sassy and entertaining. Cool looking chickens, some cats and the donkeys were also a delight. My dog kissed a donkey and my heart was full.
Shannon was super cool and helpful. We’d move in if she let us lol
Peaceful setting and gorgeous sunset and rise. Highly recommend.

review_text: Do not for one second hesitate to book this adorable space! It looks exactly as the pictures show, probably even better because it is the sweetest little farm all around you. Shannon and Kevin are friendly, responsive, proactive and full of information about the local area. They gave clear instructions for how to find the property and how to enjoy it (as well as what not to do which was super helpful in setting expectations for our kids). The interior is adorable and the porch was a fabulous place to end and then start our day. There are also a decent amount of food options that are extremely close, though you feel tucked away from the hustle and bustle completely at Dream Acres. Our children had a blast, we cannot wait to go back!

Stayed with kids
review_text: Shannon’s farm stay is a little oasis a little outside of Florence. It’s hard to find dog and kid friendly stays so we were so appreciative of this stay on our way back down to Florida. Our 6 and 4 year old loved feeding the animals and Shannon ( “farmer Shannon” to our son) let them follow and help her on her nightly chores which was an added bonus after a long days drive. It was an especially hot and humid day so we didn’t get the full farm experience as we couldn’t stay outside too long, but the hour or so we did get to spend was very worth it. An amazing seafood joint (Tubbs) is a short 10 minute drive away and we spent an hour or so there hiding from the heat with the kids as well. Our two small children slept well on the bottom bunk while we shared the Queen pullout sofa and had our baby in a pack and play next to us. The farm fresh eggs served as an added treat when we arrived to help keep the kids going! Thank you Shannon!

review_text:
Shannon,
Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Wrapping up my summer trip as the “Aunty who can” was made so much easier with your beautiful farm.
The children were so content and happy knowing we were surrounded by beautiful animals who are cared for so well. The property was well maintained and allowed us to just bask in nature.
If you are concerned about places to eat, simply download door dash and you will have multiple options to choose from. Keep in mind, farm experiences are on the weekends, so if you want a more personal experience with the animals book during the weekend.
This farm, is full of love and I will be back with my hubby and daughters for a weekend getaway soon. Thank you so much again Shannon, you made a tired Aunty/mommy feel right at home.

There isn much to choose from for dining, so you may want to grab something and bring it with you. We got take-out at the nearby chinese restaurant and it was surprisingly very good! It didnt look like much on the outside, but their vegetarian options were plentiful and done very well. I would recommend this stay to anyone. Oops - almost forgot the lovely animals, very sweet alpacas, goats and sheep - just fell in love 10X over.

rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
·
January 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Shannon was kind enough to allow our pets to stay with us in the booking so we truly appreciate that. The place itself looked just like in the pictures.
We did have some trouble locating the cottage entry. We called the host's phone # at least 3 times but seeing that there was no response and that the message from the host we received earlier that day indicated check-in ended at 11:00 pm we need it to find the cottage quickly. When we booked this place nor the next day after our check-in was this displayed on the listing. We were very nervous to miss the check-in time reason why by mistake we entered the neighbor's property. Terrible mistake as we were approached with firearms. We apologized and exit out their property. The host provides pictures but that's on the "how to get in" instructions which typically are for instructions on how to get in inside the property once located. The fact that it was already dark didn't help and being able to reach the host would have been great.

name: Adam
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Our family of 4 stayed for a long weekend on Shannon’s farm for New Year’s. We had such a great experience. The farm is small and peaceful, perfect for disconnecting from day to day life and making memories. Our boys, 11 and 6, had the best time exploring, feeding, petting, and making friends with all the animals. It’s obvious Shannon loves the farm, everything is well cared for. The cottage is in the middle of the barnyard, there are free roaming chickens and cats (all friendly), and the larger animals are fenced. It is quite cozy inside, which works well for us. Everything was clean and had just what was needed for our stay. We brought food and our InstantPot and only left for 1 meal out while there. The usual variety of restaurants are maybe 10-15 minutes away. Bonus: We had farm fresh eggs for breakfast each morning! Shannon was very kind and easy to talk to, always responsive. 5/5, we hope to visit again!

name: Kayla
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We were lucky enough to book both locations on Shannon's property this past weekend. Our stay was nothing short of incredible!! ** Everything in both locations was VERY CLEAN and smelled fresh. Cleanliness is of utmost importance to me, especially having a 2 year old. ** Waking up to the sound of the rooster crowing, and peeking out to the animals was exactly what we needed for a little family getaway. In our family, it was my husband, our 2 year old and myself. If you're not familiar with country living, don't expect to be inside since the internet could be spotty at times. However, there's so much to do outside that we didn't care to be inside. The bed was spacious and comfortable, and there were two other bunk beds located off the bathroom. The shower was relaxing and water got very hot, which is a plus. There was everything we needed to make food for us as well. Overall Shannon and Kevin were kind, down to earth, and willing to go above and beyond in helping us with whatever we needed! To note, the eggs they provided from their free range chickens were delicious. Although we have chickens and ducks at our little farm, it's still exciting to wake up on another farm and have eggs for breakfast. We definitely cannot wait to be back again and visit everyone.

I really enjoyed the peacefulness of this home. It rained so I couldn't enjoy the back porch or the fire pit but I plan to visit again in November or December and hopefully my family and I get to make some s'mores! lol
I think I left everything as she asked. When booking the check out time is 10:00 am. On the fridge in the kitchen check out time is 11:00 a.m. I could of slept an extra hour in that nice cozy king size bed. So I wasn't sure which time is correct.Other than that It was lovely and would recommend it for anyone looking for a nice country peaceful getaway.
Great Job Wanda❤️

·

,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
The reviews are 100% Correct!
After being in South Carolina for two weeks with pups in tow, we began heading out on the long journey home. Abruptly however, we had car trouble that took 8 hours to resolve and caused essentially a lost day of travel. We needed respite close to the dealership and quickly found this beautiful home away from home. Thanks so much to Wanda, who responded immediately and welcomed an early check-in. Our stress from the day melted away as we circled round the back and stood under the tall trees and felt the calming breeze. Bliss! Pictures do not capture justly the property which is fantastically decorated for that sweet tea and fresh from-the-oven cookie feel. Speaking of happiness, yummy snacks were left abound, likened to a buffet. Nom. Nom. Thank you! Rest assured your visit will be idyllic and I recommend that you stay as long as you can, for THIS was the ONLY Airbnb location we’ve visited where my husband said it felt like home.
Happy Travels. XOXO

review_text: An absolute hidden gem! Our family stopped here traveling to and from Florida, and it was such a perfect airbnb. We arrived both times in the evening time, and the home was well-lit for us to find (also was only about 5 minutes from i95). The home was sparkling clean, cozy, cute, and we felt right "at home" as soon as we walked in. Our family sure did appreciate the snacks and coffee bar provided! We also loved resting and relaxing on both the front and back porch with our pup, Lucy. A very peaceful backyard - just what we needed for us to rest after driving long hours. We also felt very safe knowing that the owners lived directly across from the home, if we needed anything! We can't say enough good things about this little treasure of a home, I'm sure that we will be back when traveling down south again. Thank you so much for opening your adorable home and hosting us!!

The cottage is so cute and cozy. We felt right at home the minute we walked in. There is everything you need and more including snacks waters, coffee/tea etc.
The bed was very comfortable. We watched a movienin comfortable livingroom. There’s a nice big yard perfect for our dogs to get some exercise after a long day of driving. Quiet rural area but close to I-95 and other attractions, restaurants, stores etc.
Wanda was very friendly and responsive. We had a short but wonderful stay. I highly recommend and would definitely stay again on our next trip to FL.

review_text: Wanda was a great host and the accommodation was convenient and well appointed. The only ding concerns the website disclosures. Specifically, the pets on furniture rule and corresponding fee is buried on the website so we did not learn of this until arrival, at which point, it was too late to make other arrangements. I suggest that simply charging a flat $50 fee for pets would be more transparent and consistent with a 'pet friendly' policy. We would have gladly paid this up-front. Additional fees for any pet-related damage (beyond residual pet hair) would, of course be warranted.

Comfy beds is my number one thing and they had those. Very clean and cozy and charming. Very roomy and cute decor and I loved the character they left from the old building! Very responsive hosts! The sound machines was a helpful touch!
We are perfectly nimble but if you have trouble getting around this might not be a fit for you if you have a cane, walker or wheelchair, as there are lots “funky/charming” ups and downs to move around the space.
The listing says house so that confused me a bit to realize it was a downstairs apartment. So, just know there could be someone walking around upstairs at 7am. But it wasn’t too noisy at all and the whole downstairs has its own courtyard and entrance which is really nice!

review_text: This was my first air bnb experience and it was great! Aron and Collin were great to work with! They answered all my questions within minutes. It's a very cute and clean space! My daughter was doing a clinical rotation for her college at McLeod Regional Medical Center for 7 weeks. We needed a safe and comfortable space for her to stay that was close to the hospital. My daughter really enjoyed the space. She said the bed was super comfortable and enjoyed being able to control the air conditioning. She had everything she needed for a long term stay, including a washer and dryer. As a mom, I also appreciated that the owners came by the property to check on things and made their presence known. I felt that my daughter was safe while staying there. It was a great experience and we highly recommend! Aron and Collin were great hosts!

review_text:
This place is absolutely lovely! Such sweet details throughout — it’s open, clean, and cozy. Aron and Collin were gracious hosts and provided us with all the info we needed before arriving. They were so accommodating for us; would definitely recommend this spot!
My only recommendation is that anyone who is a light sleeper bring sound canceling headphones or earbuds. There was noise (just people walking around, nothing loud) coming from the upstairs part of the duplex until well past midnight. I wouldn’t have been able to sleep without my AirPods. It wasn’t anything terribly disturbing, but for anyone who is sensitive to noise, it’s something to be aware of!

name: Jacque
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
Today
,
·
Group trip
review_text: The house was remarkably clean. It is updated, spacious and well-equipped, down to fun games. Patricia was responsive, helpful and kind. The house was bigger than the pictures showed, IMO. We were 5 women in town for tennis state championships and the various venues were all within 15 - 20 minutes from the home. The home is in a low-rent community of similar, respectful homes of seemingly hard-working people. Some nights were loud outdoors (neighbors coming in late, hanging out outside) but we never once felt unsafe and we all just used White Noise apps on our phones to ensure a great night's sleep. Directly across from the community is a large and nice-looking park. Otherwise the home isn't far from amenities like grocery stores, gas stations and chain restaurants. I'd definitely book this home again when we're in town for tennis again. (Of note: the home allows pets, so one of our teammates had to get a hotel room after the first night due to allergies...the rest of us didn't react.)

review_text: My family and I were in town for my daughter’s graduation, which is not only an exciting and wonderful time, but can prove stressful as well when trying to accommodate a large group of people. Tania‘s place took that extra worry away. Her place is located in a beautiful, quiet residential neighborhood and when we walked into the house we were quite impressed. Everything was beautifully decorated and her place was spotless. For a group of 8, we never felt crowded and were all very comfortable. Beds are always the deal maker or breaker for me, and THOSE beds were COMFORTABLE!!! I wish I could’ve stayed in the bed much longer 😄:) Each of the bathrooms were stocked with the necessary toiletries and the little snack basket in the kitchen added a nice touch. We got lucky with this place for sure!

,
·

,
·
Group trip
review_text: I've stayed in a lot of airbnb's, but this was without a doubt one of the best ones. It was updated, had enough furniture to in the living space to accommodate 6 people, the beds are relatively comfortable, and it was VERY clean. I never had to worry about getting in touch, because the communication was fast and consistent. We were very grateful for the ammenities that were provided, specifically the coffee products and the shower items. One of us forgot our toiletry travel bag, so it was a relief to find shampoo, conditioner, body wash AND lotion! We also enjoyed exploring the area and some of the local events going on during our time here; this space is near one of the main strips with gas stations, restaurants, shopping, and not too far from the downtown area. The price tag might be a little bit higher than most, and it can be scary to choose a space without a lot of reviews, but I assure you it's worth it! If we ever find ourselves back in Florence, this will be my go to :)

review_text:
-At first I was skeptical about renting a property with no review, however, Leslie was transparent and always available with any questions I had. The property is amazing and looks exactly like the pictures! It’s also very close to the hospitals and eateries.
- I stayed here with 4 of my family members and they could not stop talking it. The words they used to describe the house is “homey, comfortable, and clean”. The king suite has its own bathroom and living area, and the two smaller rooms provide optimal privacy. The kitchen had everything you needed including seasonings, pots, appliance, tea and coffee. The bathrooms were stocked with toiletries and great quality towels. There is also a washer/dryer, which Leslie provides detergent for. I have already recommended the property to others and would not hesitant to stay here again. Thank you Leslie for the Southern Hospitality!

We would highly recommend this beautiful home.
